charges.charge_disposition: Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Richard J. Arcara on 5/10/2005 as to Deft Yolanda Windley (7); Sentencing; Count 1ss. The Court accepts the terms and conditions of the plea agreement and the plea of guilty. The Presentence Investigation Report is placed in the record under seal. If an appeal is filed, counsel on appeal will be permitted access to the sealed report, except that counsel on appeal will not be permitted access to the recommendation section. Deft is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for time served; the cost of incarceration fee is waived. Upon release (today), Deft shall be placed on supervised release for 1 year with standard and special conditions. No fine. Deft to pay $100.00 special mandatory assessment. The Court grants Govt motion to dismiss Count 2 of the origianl indictment and count 2 of the superseding indictment as to this Deft. Appearances: Govt - Mary Clare Kane; Deft - Matthew Pynn; USPO - Diane Root.

2-27-07: Deft sentenced to probation for a period of one year. While on probation, deft not to commit to any further crimes -- deft not to possess any firearms or other dangerous device -- deft not to have any controlled substances -- deft to comply with the std conditions of probation -- deft to submit to drug testing as required -- deft to submit to search of person, property, etc. Fine is remitted. Special Assessment in the amt of $25 imposed.

charges.charge_description: 18:922(g)(1) and 924(a)(2) UNLAWFUL TRANSPORT OF FIREARMS, ETC.(1ss)

charges.charge_disposition: Deft is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 5 months to be served at the Buffalo Halfway House; the cost of incarceration fee is waived. Upon release from imprisonment, Deft shall be placed on supervised release for a term of 3 years with standard and special conditions. Deft shall comply with the conditions of home detention for 5 months. During the period of home detention, Deft is to remain at his place of residence except for employment and other activities approved by USPO. Deft shall wear an electronic monitoring device and follow electronic monitoring procedures as outlined in Probation Form 61. Deft shall pay a portion or the total cost of electronic monitoring services at the daily rate provided by USPO. The daily rate and payment schedule are subject to periodic adjustments by USPO. No fine. Deft to pay $100.00 mandatory assessment. Deft shall forfeit his interests in the property specifically set forth in Part VII of the Plea Agreement and incorporated herein. The Court grants voluntary surrender. The Court grants the Govt's motion to dismiss Count 2 of the Superseding Indictment as to this Deft.

2-13-07: Deft sentenced to probation under 18:3607 (for one year). Fine imposed in the amt of $500 payable at the rate of $50 per month until fully paid prior to probation. Entry of judgment is deferred. While on probation, deft not to commit any further crimes. Deft not to possess firearms or destructive devices. Deft not to possess any controlled substances. Deft to submit to substance test, evaluation and enter treatment if necessary and not leave treatment without permission. While in treatment, deft to abstain from alcohol. Deft to contribute to treatment as determined . Deft to submit to search of person, property, etc. Interest is waived on fine. USPO authorized to release financial information on any unpaid fine. Deft to notify USPO if assets received and not to disburse interest in any assets, etc. Deft not to incur any debts, no new credit cards, etc.

If an appeal is filed, counsel on appeal will be permitted access to the sealed report, except that counsel on appeal will not be permitted access to the recommendation section. The Court grants the Govt?s motion to dismiss count 2 of the superseding indictment as to this Deft. Appearances: Govt - Mary Clare Kane; Deft - John Dorn; USPO - Susan Murray.
